definition: original/former/originally/formerly/at first/so, actually, as it turns out
Hara (Japanese surname)
former/original/primary/raw/level/cause/source
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: I need to get back in shape.
sentences.chinese: 我要減回到原來的身材。

sentences.english: Will they beat the 83 century record for the championships?Yes or no?
sentences.chinese: 他們這次比賽能打破原來83次單球破百的記錄嗎？

sentences.english: Keep the cable coils stacked in the same order as they were when they were on the drum.
sentences.chinese: 在鼓輪上保持鋼索盤的旋轉方向與原來一致。

sentences.english: It turned out that a number of tribes in ancient China, there is looting marriage customs.
sentences.chinese: 原來，在古代中國的一些部落，有搶婚的習俗。

sentences.english: Cheng Xi and Tang Zheng sweet took pictures, and to the two original rented house.
sentences.chinese: 程曦和唐正甜蜜的照了相，又到兩個原來租住的房子。

sentences.english: Of the original scheme hardly a wrack remains.
sentences.chinese: 原來的計劃幾乎一點殘跡也未留下。

sentences.english: The original resteruant has been changed to a tea house now.
sentences.chinese: 還有，原來喫包子的地方現在改成茶室了。

sentences.english: The original user then decrypts the data with his private key.
sentences.chinese: 原來的用戶，然後用他的解密私鑰數據。

sentences.english: It was my neighbor’s wife! I rushed in without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 原來是我鄰居的妻子在叫喚，我毫不猶豫的衝了過去。

sentences.english: He said so, just let a person remember, originally he is really a soldier.
sentences.chinese: 他這樣一說，才讓人想起，原來他真的是一個軍人。

sentences.english: Talk to her more and you will find that she isn't 70 bad 71 you thought she was.
sentences.chinese: 和她談過多次你就會發現她不像你原來認爲的那麼壞。

sentences.english: The original everything you say it is even a vapour.
sentences.chinese: 原來你所說的一切不過都是過眼雲煙。

sentences.english: Do not drop your determination which you wanted to just because of a casw of crabs.
sentences.chinese: 不要只因一次失敗，就放棄你原來決心想達到的目的。

sentences.english: And if I go look at the polar form of this, OK, good, looks right, right?
sentences.chinese: 現在它有一個不同的座標，以及跟原來相同的角度？

sentences.english: The third-graders are having a traffic education lesson.
sentences.chinese: 原來是三年級的學生正在上交通安全教育課。

sentences.english: The film is made in such an easy way.
sentences.chinese: 原來電影製作竟是如此容易。

definition: don't tell me .../could it be that...?
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
to find/to discover

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
apparently/it seems that
to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
indeed/really/reliable/real/true
actually/in fact/really
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
here
original/originally/at first/it goes without saying/of course
